001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
004import java.lang.annotation.Inherited;
005import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
006import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
007import java.lang.annotation.Target;
008import java.lang.reflect.Field;
009import java.util.HashMap;
010import java.util.Map;
011
012/**
013 * Interface for factors that can be represented as enums with optional level
014 * labels. Provides methods for getting the label of an enum constant and for
015 * constructing an enum constant from a label. Uses memoisation to cache
016 * mappings between enum names and labels for efficient lookup.
017 *
018 * <p>
019 * Enum constants can be annotated with {@link Level} to specify a custom label;
020 * if not annotated, the enum name is used as the label by default.
021 *
022 * @author Rob Challen
023 */
024public interface Factor {
025
026        /**
027         * Annotation for specifying a custom label for an enum constant.
028         *
029         * <p>
030         * When applied to an enum constant, the value of this annotation is used as
031         * the label for that constant. If not present, the enum name is used as the
032         * label by default.
033         */
034        @Inherited
035        @Target(ElementType.FIELD)
036        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
037        public static @interface Level {
038                /**
039                 * The custom label for the enum constant.
040                 *
041                 * @return the label to use for the annotated enum constant
042                 */
043                String value();
044        }
045
046        /**
047         * Memoised functions for forward and reverse lookups between enum names and
048         * labels. The forward mapping is from enum name to label, and the reverse
049         * mapping is from label to enum name. These mappings are computed once per
050         * enum class and cached for efficient retrieval.
051         */
052        static final Memoised<Class<? extends Enum<?>>, Map<String, String>> forward = Memoised
053                        .memoise(c -> {
054                                Map<String, String> lookup = new HashMap<>();
055                                for (Field e : c.getDeclaredFields()) {
056                                        lookup.put(
057                                                        // Enum name
058                                                        e.getName(),
059                                                        // Level
060                                                        e.isAnnotationPresent(Level.class)
061                                                                        ? e.getAnnotation(Level.class).value()
062                                                                        : e.getName()
063                                        );
064                                }
065                                return lookup;
066                        });
067
068        /**
069         * Memoised function for reverse lookup from label to enum name. This
070         * function computes a mapping from labels to enum names for a given enum
071         * class. It iterates over the declared fields of the enum class and
072         * constructs a lookup map where the key is the label (either from the Level
073         * annotation or the enum name) and the value is the corresponding enum name.
074         * This allows for efficient retrieval of enum constants based on their
075         * labels.
076         */
077        static final Memoised<Class<? extends Enum<?>>, Map<String, String>> reverse = Memoised
078                        .memoise(c -> {
079                                Map<String, String> lookup = new HashMap<>();
080                                for (Field e : c.getDeclaredFields()) {
081                                        lookup.put(
082                                                        // Level
083                                                        e.isAnnotationPresent(Level.class)
084                                                                        ? e.getAnnotation(Level.class).value()
085                                                                        : e.getName(),
086                                                        // Enum name
087                                                        e.getName()
088                                        );
089                                }
090                                return lookup;
091                        });
092
093        /**
094         * Construct an enum constant of the specified type from a given label.
095         *
096         * <p>
097         * This method uses the reverse mapping to look up the enum name
098         * corresponding to the provided label. If the label is found in the mapping,
099         * the corresponding enum constant is returned; otherwise, it falls back to
100         * using the label as the enum name directly. This allows for flexible
101         * construction of enum constants based on either their labels or their
102         * names.
103         *
104         * @param <T>   the type of the enum constant to construct
105         * @param type  the class of the enum
106         * @param value the label to look up
107         * @return the enum constant corresponding to the given label
108         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the enum type does not contain a
109         *                                  constant with the specified label
110         */
111        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
112        static <T extends Enum<T>> Enum<T> fromLabel(
113                        Class<? extends Enum<?>> type, String value
114        ) {
115                Map<String, String> mapping = reverse.apply(type);
116                return Enum.valueOf((Class<T>) type, mapping.getOrDefault(value, value));
117        }
118
119        /**
120         * Get the label for this factor.
121         *
122         * <p>
123         * If this factor is an enum constant, the label is determined by checking
124         * for the presence of the {@link Level} annotation on the corresponding
125         * field. If the annotation is present, its value is used as the label;
126         * otherwise, the enum name is used as the default label. If this factor is
127         * not an enum constant, the string representation of this factor is returned
128         * as the label.
129         *
130         * @param <T> the type of the enum constant, if applicable
131         * @return the label associated with this factor
132         */
133        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
134        default <T extends Enum<T>> String getLabel() {
135                if (this.getClass().isEnum()) {
136                        T tmp = (T) this;
137                        Map<String, String> mapping = forward.apply((Class<T>) tmp.getClass());
138                        return mapping.getOrDefault(tmp.name(), tmp.name());
139                }
140                return this.toString();
141        }
142
143}
